project_abstract.cdata: The primary objective of the Public Enterprise and Restructuring and Privatization Support Project is to support Togo's policy of divesting from productive sectors and promote an accelerated private sector-led development of economic activities. There are three main components. The Public Enterprise Restructuring and Privatization component supports the government's policy of divesting from productive sectors by contracting out the preparation and execution of transactions to specialized firms, reducing the number of public enterprises, addressing labor redundancies, and implementing a public information and communication strategy. The second component, Reform of the Post and Telecommunications Sectors, provides technical assistance that implements extensive reform, including privatizing the main operator and liberalizing telecommunications services under a new regulatory framework; and restructures postal activities designed to improve profitability. The Financial Sector component, the third component, supports privatizing, restructuring, or liquidating selected financial institutions; strengthens the legal and judiciary systems; and promotes the microfinance sector.
